text: New Zealand and Iceland are on the brink

Zealand has currently one active case of

been largely down to the government's

on New Zealand had its first case
confirmed at the end of February and
within a month the country was in full
lockdown at level 4 what this meant was
only essential services were running so
hospitals pharmacies and supermarkets
everything else had to be closed
including any takeaways of food delivery
services and people were urged to stay
home these rules are very very clear
they were on TV they were on air brakes
on radio and on online platforms as well
so it was very clear as to what people
were and weren't allowed to do New
Zealand also closed its borders
and any Nationals returning home had to
be put into mandatory quarantine this
meant that the government could contain
the cases track any new ones and alert
those who are affected and eliminate

achieved we moved out of level four
lockdown and into liberals with fewer

for just over two weeks and the economy
has more or less opened up again
everything is back up and running
people are still producing social
distancing including businesses so
although it was a cautious and rather
slow approach to begin with it's seems
to have paid off Polina Lau their well
New Zealand strategy isn't the only
successful one Iceland which has had
